Context:
The Daphne Cockwell Centre for Health Sciences at George Brown College is located in downtown Toronto, overlooking the Toronto harbour. It was built to emphasize interprofessional team-based education and is equipped with state-of-the-art labs and classrooms, informal learning spaces, rooftop terraces, and supports emerging themes in health care delivery in Ontario.

George Brown College offers programs for students throughout their health careers, from entry to practice to postgraduate studies and professional development. The college operates health and wellness clinics called WAVE (Wellness, Applied Research and Visionary Education), which provides access to real clients for students to practice their skills in a controlled environment. Appointments can be made by visiting the WAVE client services reception on the third floor of the Daphne Cockwell Centre for Health Sciences at 51 Dockside Dr., calling (416) 415-4547, or emailing for scheduling.

The WAVE clinics include a Dental Clinic, Hearing Clinic, Fitness Studios, Active Living Clinic, and Health Promotion. The Simulation Centre in the Daphne Cockwell Centre for Health Sciences provides students with opportunities to learn in environments that mirror real-world settings, including hospital and long-term care environments and a replicated bachelor apartment (Health eHome). The Simulation Centre partners with other educational institutions, health-care facilities, and related associations such as Baycrest Hospital, CAMH, Emily’s House, and Philip Aziz Centre.

Programs offered: Throughout their health careers, from entry to practice to postgraduate studies and professional development. Specific programs are not mentioned in the text.
